title.narrative: Building Sustainable markets for honey products

description.narrative:
The 2017 AP for Meles was initiated taking into consideration the major organizational, financial, marketing gaps that were witnesses during the assessment phase. After developing an extensive action plan for 2017 & 2018, the 2018 activities remain to be executed. Thus, this will be a continuation of the 2017 action plan with some adjustments made.
To date, the union’s core challenge remains to be fulfilling the necessary manpower and proactive marketing. The union owns an organic honey which demands specialized market (high end market) to be successful for sales. The union has collected 55 quintals of honey from 16 primary cooperatives, waiting to be sold to the market. This demands good market linkage and vigorous selling activities, as sales shop will not accommodate all the market segment for Meles. The unions financial situation can be improved with proper recruitment of required staff, with additional support in implementing the health check gaps of the union, and business plan training. The union will get an Agripool support to improve the marketing aspects of the union. The marketing initiative of the union will be the main focus of the action plan and will get assistance in recruitment of marketing/sales staff, will open the second outlet, and will go through B2B arrangements with different high-end consumers.
Build sustainable market: • Sales of 55 quintals of honey • Enable PCs to process beeswax• 1 B2B initiated and executed
